> I think we're stuck with the super-fast characters... instead of 
considering 
> it a handicap, I try to use it to my own advantage. For example, 
I'll have a 
> character run toward a foe, shooting his weapon, and suddenly back 
off just 
> before I run into him. The shots build up behind you, and as the 
enemy walks 
> straight toward you, they hit him all at once like a ton of bricks. 
Brutal.


I've actually done something similiar with an archer and exploding 
bolts [Only problem was pulling the archer out soon enough to avoid 
killing the archer].  Against normal opponents, that is instant 
slaughter.


I would be crueler about chain lightning:  it has to kill an opponent 
before it could spread (I've seen chain lightning pass through 
opponents without killing them) and the limit would be set the player 
(minimum 5, maximum 50) and graphical representation of chain 
lightning would be optional [that would speed things up quite a bit], 
but the speed setting for chain lightning would be set so high that it 
basically kills an opponent, next second kills another opponent, until 
it runs out.
